text: The 2002 Asian Cycling Championships took place at Bangkok, Thailand from 4 to 10 May 2002. ==Medal summary== ===Road=== ====Men==== {| |- |Individual road race | | | |- |Individual time trial | | | |} ====Women==== {| |- |Individual road race | | | |- |Individual time trial | | | |} ===Track=== ====Men==== {| |- |Sprint | | | |- |1 km time trial | | | |- |Keirin | | | |- |Individual pursuit | | | |- |Points race | | | |- |Elimination | | | |- |Team sprint | Keiichi Omori Kiyofumi Nagai Tomohiro Nagatsuka |valign=top| |valign=top| |- |Team pursuit |valign=top| | Hossein Askari Amir Zargari Abbas Saeidi Tanha Mousa Arbati Alireza Haghi |valign=top| |} ====Women==== {| |- |Sprint | | | |- |500 m time trial | | | |- |Individual pursuit | | | |- |Points race | | | |- |Elimination | | | |} ==Medal table== ==External links== * Results Asia Asia Cycling Category:Asian Cycling Championships Category:International cycle races hosted by Thailand
